definition: to hand over/to deliver/to pay (money)/to turn over/to make friends/to intersect (lines)/variant of 跤[jiao1]
easy/amiable/to change/to exchange/prefix corresponding to the English adjective suffix "-able" or "-ible"
surname Yi/abbr. for 易經|易经[Yi4 jing1], the Book of Changes
abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan

sentences.english: This is the so-called non-trading day effects.
sentences.chinese: 本文希望研究中国股票市场的非交易日效应的表现。

sentences.english: Zheng Mian low adjustment has 6 trading days, or choose the direction in the late.
sentences.chinese: 郑棉在低位调整已6个交易日，后期或将选择方向。

sentences.english: However, this requirement shall not apply to transfers totaling less than 10,000 shares per exchange day.
sentences.chinese: 但每一交易日转让股数未超过一万股者，免予申报。

sentences.english: The company's U.S.-traded shares fell 30 percent in the first trading session after the report.
sentences.chinese: 公司在美国上市的股价在第一个交易日下跌了30%。

sentences.english: The instructions will be processed on the next dealing date after it is approved by the Company.
sentences.chinese: 指示经本公司批准后，于下一个交易日进行。

sentences.english: China's markets were mostly higher Friday, the last trading day in the Year of the Ox.
sentences.chinese: 今天是牛年最后一个交易日。

sentences.english: By referring to your trading journal, you learn from your past mistakes.
sentences.chinese: 参阅你的交易日记，从你的过去错误中学习。

sentences.english: Only one day had a move of less than 1%.
sentences.chinese: 只有一个交易日波幅小于1%。

sentences.english: KD index yesterday killed many line-breaking, Ding trading day under easy day arrived in rally action.
sentences.chinese: KD指标昨破杀多线，下亇交易日易日多抵反弹动作。

definition: daily lower limit on the price of a stock
in a few days/one of these days
extent of a rise (in prices etc)/amount of increase/growth (typically expressed as a percentage)
stock market index/share price index/abbr. for 股票指數|股票指数[gu3 piao4 zhi3 shu4]
(of a stock on the stock market) to close at (a certain price)
market price/quotation of market price/the current market situation
